member.name: T:Netick.Unity.NetworkRigidbody
member.summary: This component is used to replicate the position and rotation of an object. Therefore, it’s the same as the Network Transform, the difference is that Network Rigidbody must be used if you want to have client-side prediction over PhysX objects since it replicates several other properties necessary for correct prediction.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.InitializePool(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes the pool for the specified prefab. After this method has been called for a certain prefab, all instances of that prefab will be recycled and reset when created/destroyed.
Note: this method should only be called on , in other words, just after Netick has been started.
member.param: How many instances to be preloaded.
Pass true to hide inactive pool members.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.Instantiate(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Instantiates a prefab. This must be called instead of or its variations.
Note: this must be called only for non-networked prefabs. If you want to instantiate a network prefab, use instead.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.NetworkInstantiate(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion,Netick.NetworkPlayer,Netick.SpawnPredictionKey)
member.summary:
Instantiates a network prefab.
Commonly, this should only be called on the server, since only the server can instantiate network prefabs. However, the client can also call this to spawn-predict a prefab by providing a spawn key which must be the same on the server and client when this method is called. Read the docs to learn more about how to use spawn-prediction.
Note: make sure the prefab has been registered.
Note: the specified input source will be given to every child of this prefab.
member.param: Input source of the instantiated object.

members.member:
/// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// /// ///
Destroys a network object. Only call this on the server or on the client for spawn-predicted objects which have -1 Ids.
Note: never call this on a child of the original prefab, only the root of the prefab.
The object to destroy.

member.summary: [Client Only] The of the server you are connected to. Returns null if you are not connected to any server, or if you are the server.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.IsConnected
member.summary: [Client Only] Returns true if this client is currently connected to a server.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.ConnectedClients
member.summary:
A list containing all connected clients currently.
Note: if you want the clients + the server, use .

summary.para: A list containing all connected clients currently, in addition to the server (when started as a host).
Note: if you only want the clients, use .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.ConnectedServer
member.summary: The server the client is connected to.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.Objects
member.summary:
A list containing all simulated/registered network objects [] currently.
Note: to get a network object by id, use:

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.LocalPlayer
member.summary: This player.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.FixedDeltaTime
member.summary: Time period between network simulation steps. Same as

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.Tick
member.summary:
Current simulation tick.
On the server, it's always going forward/increasing.
On the client, during resimulations it returns the current resimulated tick. To check for resimulations, use .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.AuthoritativeTick
member.summary: Last received tick on the client. On the server, it returns the same value as

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.PredictedTick
member.summary:
Last predicted tick.
On the client, it always returns the predicted tick of the client, regardless of whether it's a resimulation or not.
On the server, it returns the same value as Sandbox.Tick

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input/tick of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.InKBps
member.summary: Incoming data in kilobytes per second (KBps).

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.OutKBps
member.summary: Outgoing data in kilobytes per second (KBps).

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.InterpolationDelay
member.summary: [Client Only] Interpolation delay in seconds.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.RTT
member.summary: [Client Only] The round-trip time (RTT) of the client in seconds.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.CurrentRpcSource
member.summary: Always always returns null except when called inside the body of an RPC method, it returns the we are executing RPCs from.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.PostNetworkFixedUpdate
member.summary:
Called after all NetworkFixedUpdate methods have been executed.
Note: it's called with every resimulation on the client.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.PreNetworkFixedUpdate
member.summary:
Called before any NetworkFixedUpdate method have been executed.
Note: it's called with every resimulation on the client.

member.summary: Gets the with the specified id. Returns null in case no object with that id exists.

member.summary: Converts to time in seconds.

member.summary: Attachs a to the simulation.

member.summary: Deattachs a from the simulation.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.Connect(System.Int32,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary:
[Client Only] Connects to a remote server.
Note: if you are already connected to a server, and you want to connect to a different one, you have to disconnect before calling this. Otherwise this method does nothing.
Note: connectionData array length should not be more than 300 if you are using Netick Transport.
member.param: Data sent with the connection request. Could be used to decide whether or not to allow the connection.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.Kick(Netick.ServerConnection)
member.summary: [Server Only] Disconnects a client from the server.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.DisconnectFromServer
member.summary: [Client Only] Disconnects this client from the server.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.CreateMatch(System.String)
member.summary: [Server Only] Creates a match. Only functional if the low-level transport has support for matchmaking.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.RefreshMatchList
member.summary: Requests an update to the match list. Only functional if the low-level transport has support for matchmaking.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox.SwitchScene(System.Int32)
member.summary: [Server Only] Switches to a different scene. This must be called instead of or its variations.

member.summary: Unloads a scene asynchronously.

member.summary:
Gets a Network Prefab by name.
Note: this causes GC.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.NetworkRigidbody2D
member.summary: This component is used to replicate the position and rotation of an object. Therefore, it’s the same as the Network Transform, the difference is that Network Rigidbody 2D must be used if you want to have client-side prediction over Box2D objects since it replicates several other properties necessary for correct prediction.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject
member.summary: Any GameObject which needs to be synced/replicated must have a Network Object component. It’s the component that tells Netick a GameObject is networked. Although not every child GameObject needs it, only the root has to have a Network Object.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.SpawnTick
member.summary: The tick which this object was spawned at.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.Parent
member.summary: The parent of this object.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsClient
member.summary: Returns true if this is a client.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsServer
member.summary: Returns true if this is the server.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsOwner
member.summary: Returns true if this is the owner of this Object. In this version of Netick: Server=Owner.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsInputSource
member.summary: Returns true if this is providing inputs for this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsProxy
member.summary: Returns true if we neither provide inputs nor own this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.InputSource
member.summary: Returns the source (/) of inputs for this . If the source of inputs is remote (from a client) it returns that , while on the input source itself it returns the local .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.InterestGroup
member.summary: The interest group of this object. This can only be changed if BroadPhaseFilter is set to Custom.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.HasValidId
member.summary: Returns true if this has been added to the simulation by Netick, and thus has a valid id.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkObject.SetParent(Netick.Unity.NetworkObject)
member.summary: [Owner/InputSource Only] Changes the parent of this object.
member.param: The object which will become the parent of this object.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.SingleInstanceEnforcer
member.summary: Add this component to a GameObject to ensure only a single instance of it will exist at the same time, across all sandboxes.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.NetickConfig
member.summary: Config class for Netick.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.Sandbox
member.summary: The containing this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.Object
member.summary: The this behaviour is attached to.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.NetworkStart
member.summary: Called when this behaviour has been added to the simulation.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.NetworkDestroy
member.summary: Called when this behaviour has been removed from the simulation.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.NetworkUpdate
member.summary: Called every frame. Executed before NetworkFixedUpdate.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.NetworkFixedUpdate
member.summary:
Called every fixed-time network update/tick. Any changes/updates to the network state must happen here.
On the client, if you are the Input Source or if this Object.PredictionMode is set to None, it will be called several times in one update/tick during resimulations. To check for resimulations, use [].

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetickBehaviour.NetworkRender
member.summary: Called every frame. Executed after NetworkUpdate and NetworkFixedUpdate.
member.para: IMPORTANT NOTE: properties (which can be interpolated) marked with [] attribute will return interpolated values when accessed in this method.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.BehaviourId
member.summary: The network id of this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.Id
member.summary: The network id of this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsClient
member.summary: Returns true if this is a client.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsServer
member.summary: Returns true if this is the server.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsOwner
member.summary: Returns true if this is the owner of this Object. In this version of Netick: Server=Owner.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsInputSource
member.summary: Returns true if this is providing inputs to this Object.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsProxy
member.summary: Returns true if we neither provide inputs nor own this .

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsResimulating
member.summary: Returns true if we are currently resimulating a previous input of the past. On the server, it always returns false since only the clients resimulate.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.IsPredicted
member.summary: On the client, it returns true only if the client is predicting this object. On the server, it always returns true.

member.name: P:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.InputSource
member.summary: Returns the source (/) of inputs for this . If the source of inputs is remote (from a client) it returns that , while on the input source itself it returns the local .

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.FetchInput``1(``0@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetchs a network input for this tick. Returns false if no input source is currently providing inputs to this Object, or when input loss occurs (in case of a remote input source).

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.OnInputSourceLeft
member.summary: Called on the server when the input source of this Object has disconnected.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.NetworkBehaviour.OnSpawnPredictionSucceeded
member.summary: Called on the client when the server confirms that this object has been successfully spawn-predicted and therefore has a valid SceneLoadId.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.NetworkAnimator
member.summary: This component is used to replicate Unity's Animator parameters and states.

member.name: T:Netick.Unity.Network
member.summary: Manages Netick and its clients, and is used to start and shut down Netick.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.Init(Netick.Unity.NetickConfig,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Initializes Netick. This is automatically called when you start Netick.
If you don't provide a , Netick will use the default config, which can be modified/found in (Netick -> Settings).

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.Shutdown(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shuts down Netick and destroys all clients. The shutdown will occur in the next frame. For immediate shutdown, use:

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.ShutdownImmediately(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shuts down Netick and destroys all clients immediately.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.ShutdownSandbox(Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shuts down a specific sandbox.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.Focus(Netick.Unity.NetworkSandbox)
member.summary: Focus on a specific sandbox.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.StartAsServerAndClient(Netick.Unity.NetworkTransportProvider,System.Int32,UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts both a client (or clients) and a server.
member.param: Number of client sandboxes to create.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.StartAsMultiplePeers(Netick.Unity.NetworkTransportProvider,System.Int32,UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts multiple peers together.
member.param: Number of client clients to create.
Should we start a server too.

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.StartAsClient(Netick.Unity.NetworkTransportProvider,System.Int32,UnityEngine.GameObject)

member.name: M:Netick.Unity.Network.StartAsServer(Netick.Unity.NetworkTransportProvider,System.Int32,UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Starts Netick as a server.
